title: Wages and GDP in England 1500-2000, compare

content.prompt: For the late nineteenth and the twentieth century, which of the following best explains the relationship between the trends reflected in the two charts?

choices.label: Technological changes in this period led to dramatic increases in industrial productivity.
Women’s entry into the paid workforce was offset by higher rates of unemployment and the wider adoption of the eight-hour work day.
English GDP growth in this period was in large part driven by the economic exploitation of overseas colonies, not by domestic labor.
Expanded leisure and recreation opportunities raised workers’ morale

topic.text: 6.3: Second Wave Industrialization and Its Effects

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Compare the arguments or main ideas of two sources.
